message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.PL

This paper discusses a new class of attacks that abuse modern browser APIs to perform malicious operations. The paper focuses on the security implications of these attacks and proposes potential defense strategies. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also discusses the design and implementation of a prototype system, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.SE (Software Engineering). The paper involves the abuse of resources and computation, which could fall under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper discusses the use of JavaScript APIs, which could also fall under cs.PL (Programming Languages).
